executiveSummary: Neil Desai pitched his app 'KAF' (also referred to as 'Kate') on Shark Tank, seeking $50,000 for 5% equity. The app hides communications from selected contacts, marketed as a 'cheaters app' but reframed by some sharks as a privacy app. After negotiations, Neil accepted a joint deal from Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John for $70,000 in exchange for 35% equity.
keyDecisions: Neil Desai accepted an investment deal from Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John for $70,000 in exchange for 35% equity in KAF.

actionItems.task: Reposition the KAF app as a broader privacy application to reach wider markets beyond its 'cheaters app' branding.
Collaborate with Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John to expand business reach and marketing strategy.

nextSteps: Neil Desai will begin working with Kevin O’Leary and Daymond John to develop and market the app under its new investment structure, potentially exploring rebranding opportunities.
